reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time in the peak district and we loved it. It was made even more special by our choice of b&b. Jean made you feel at ease and at home as soon as we arrived. The beds were comfy and the breakfast was superb.! The b&b is in a lovely location and just a short walk into Bakewell. We will be returning sooner rather than later!!
reviews.title: Will definately return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: very welcoming B n B in a lovely setting, with river flowing at the end of the garden. Fantastic breakfast with local fresh ingredients. A short, pretty walk to the town centre, and loads to explore in the area. We stayed in the annexe room (with en-suite shower and loo) and to our amazement, there were TWO armchairs - you only ever get one in most double rooms. Plenty of attention to detail e.g. good variety of drinks (incuding decaff, hot chocolate) in the welcome tray, and all sorts of toiletry extras e.g. cotton buds, cotton wool pads etc). Lovely, friendly hosts. Best B n B.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly, comfortable, great breakfast...more than u can eat!
reviews.title: Fabulous would not hesitate to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without hestation a lovely place for a few days away
reviews.title: Excellent Weekend Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent stay at the RiverWalk B&B recently. We arrived pretty damp after a long walk in a rainy Dovedale and Jean was more than happy to dry out our gear. After a hot bath, we were heading in to Bakewell over the bridge and a short walk in to town. The rooms are well presented, if a little dated, but exceptionally clean and very comfy indeed. The B&B is lovely and quiet and in a great location, next to the river with parking available. Breakfasts are excellent, with fresh coffee and locally sourced produce. We would recommend Le Mistral, Castle Inn and H's Wine Bar for excellent food and drink. All in all, a superb weekend away, made even better by staying at RiverWalk B&B.
reviews.title: Really enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A group of five friends (2 couples and one single) stayed for one night to visit the Hartington Cookery School in Bakewell . Our choice of accommodation was limited as we wanted three rooms near the centre of town. As people who use B&B accommodation a great deal, we know what we like.
reviews.title: Excellent breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great opposite the river with good road and walking access to the town centre. We were greeted by the owner at the front door in a friendly manner and shown to our respective rooms
reviews.title: Another perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B has no separate sitting area for guests so we had to gather to one bedroom to discuss anything which was rather crowded!
reviews.title: Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our well heated, ground floor was rather small with a handbasin in the room and shower and toilet in a very small, unheated en suite area but everywhere was very clean. Toiletries were all supplied. The bed was comfortable but we felt the furnishings looked a little old fashioned.
reviews.title: home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was varied and well cooked with extra toast etc supplied on request.
reviews.title: Peaceful location perfect b and b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay in the double en-suite room. Very comfortable bed, very good shower and all you could ever need in the room, including a good selection of quality hot drinks, not the 2 teabags that you get in other places! Everything was very clean and Jean was very friendly and provided great service and a fantastic breakfast to set you up for the day.
reviews.title: A perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Brilliant location just by the river as described, had great fun feeding the ducks and just a short walk into Bakewell town centre to get your tarts and puddings and great value for money.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Looking forward to going back and would definitely recommend to everyone!!
reviews.title: Perfect place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Situated in a quiet place next to the river we had a friendly welcome and could come and go as we pleased. A pleasant clean room with tea tray, TV and hairdryer plus an excellent breakfast - what more could we ask for at such a reasonable price!
reviews.title: Lovely home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a clean, friendly, convenient, warm and affordable place to stay in Bakewell. Look know further. We've just spent a single night at the River Walk and Jean and her B&B were excellent and the breakfast is to die for.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we knew we'd made a good decision. Jean met us at the door with a lovely smile, and showed us up to our room. Our bedroom was very well looked after, spotless and had an amazing view over the bridge. I usually have real difficulty sleeping, but the lovely crisp sheets, comfortable bed and the sound of the river had me out for the count within minutes.
reviews.title: An absolute gem - a home away from home! :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The next morning we went downstairs for one of Jean's legendary breakfasts. Other reviewers mentioned that you don't need much to eat for lunch and boy were they right!! A great selection of cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurts and juice were washed down with fresh (proper) coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice. After that we had some toast with marmalade and jam, then a gorgeous cooked breakfast with real Derbyshire sausages!
reviews.title: Last minute booking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Sadly we only stayed two nights, but I can honestly say that we will be back when we're next in Bakewell. Our visit was primarily to see Chatsworth which is a very short journey by car. Bakewell itself is a very short walk away from the house and is also well worth a visit.
reviews.title: River Walk, Bakewell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a quality establishment run with good old fashioned business values at it's heart! We were made to feel extremely welcome, very much valued and absolutely stunned that we could have such a lovely experience at such a reasonable price.
reviews.title: A perfect place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good work Jean, and thank you!! :-)
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable room
